titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale University Master of Fine Arts Theses In Graphic Design
Graphic Design, Master of Fine Arts Theses, Yale University
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Arts Library Special Collections staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 30, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Yale University Master of Fine Arts Theses in Graphic Design
did.abstract: The collection consists of over 600 individual Master of Fine Arts theses in graphic design from 1951 to the present.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. School of Art. Graphic Design Program

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the School of Art and the artists.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Multi-media works can only be viewed if a use copy is available.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale University Master of Fine Arts Theses in Graphic Design, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1950, the Graphic Design Program at the Yale University School of Art is a well respected program training designers in technical and theoretical issues. The two-year course of study requires students to build a coherent, investigative, and experimental body of work. The program culminates in a thesis project in which the student creates a final document in support of a long-term, multi-faceted research project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of over 600 individual theses from 1951 to the present. The theses are most often in book format, though some have more experimental formats. Individual records for the theses are also available in the library catalog.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Theses are listed in order by date, then in alphabetical order within each year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One copy includes a presentation inscription by Applegate to Theodore Sizer as well as Sizer's embossed stamp of ownership.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 volumes. Volume 2 contains supplementary examples of typefaces from two nineteenth-century publications, The Port Folio and Godey's Lady's Book .

did.unittitle: Influence of Byzantine scholars and manuscripts on early Italian printers of Greek texts.

Examples of printmaking in 12 books : potato print, waxcut, mo-glu print, corrugated cardboard print, casein cut, linocut, wood cut, bean print, string print, cardboard print, paper print, drip print.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 1 volume and 19 loose illustrations. Harry Charles Keshian earned a BFA in 1955.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robert C. Morris earned a BFA in 1955.

did.unittitle: A graphic approach to children's books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes 2 volumes. Karla Seidman earned a BFA in 1955. Her senior research project was "A Graphic Approach to Children's Books," which included the printing of a small edition of an original children's book. This children's book, Roar and More , was later published by Harper in 1956.

did.unittitle: The graphic artist and TV advertising.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The folder contains a version of Sias's thesis that was submitted in 1954. This copy has memoranda laid in by E. C. Cole and Charles H. Sawyer concerning its evaluation. The final version is dated May 2, 1955.
